clinicalDescription: Overview: Low number of red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to the body's tissues. Many types of anemia. Presentation: Can have no symptoms. Fatigue or pain but vary according to the type of anemia, the underlying cause, the severity and underlying health problemsAssessment: CBC (low hemoglobin or hematocrit), blood iron level, vit B12 level, reticulocyte count, bilirubin Plan: Different causes and treatmentsPrognosis: Very good Prognosis: and curable in many instances. The overall Prognosis: depends on the underlying cause of anemia, its severity, and the overall health of the patient.
